availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George W. Dobson (Hart Co, KY, resident; Larue County, KY, farm laborer)

body.p: Hart County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Jessamine County, Kentucky, native. Married to Elizabeth Dobson. Father of William Dobson. Farmer in Green County, Kentucky, in 1850. Employed William Johnson as a laborer in Green County in 1850. Employed by John Walter as a farm laborer in Larue County, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the 15th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from October 5, 1861, to September 1864. Resident of Hart County in 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 2, p. 142A-B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Larue County, p. 193-94.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hart County, Powder Mill, p. 367B.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 486.
KYR-0001-004-0399.
